== Main Inclusion Report for virt-manager ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/v/virt-manager/virt-manager_0.5.3-0ubuntu8.dsc]]</nowiki>; amd64 i386 powerpc 
# ''Rationale:''
** virt-manager is a graphical console which acts as a front end to libvirt (already in main) locally or remotely, which in our case will be used to manage KVM guests
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=virt-manager|CVE]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=virt-manager|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid nor daemons
** Network activity: does not open any port or accept any incoming data
** Does no directly process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data 
** Any source code review performed: soren working actively on it
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** In what situations does the package not work out of the box without configuration: 
** it requires a local or remote libvirt to work.  It provides a sensible error message if someone has not installed it.
** Does the package ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'medium': no
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?src=virt-manager|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: No critical bugs
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/v/virt-manager.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is vigorous
